title: Why wasn't Philip II able to marshal sufficient troops from the Low countries to defend the Burgundian Inheritance and instead had to import Spanish troops? - Quora

response.answer_text: The long and short of it is he had little to no support in the Netherlands due to actions of his representatives in Netherlands. There was a very small Catholic minority that supported him, but a majority of the Dutch Catholics still opposed him and wanted privileges that Philip II’s representatives took away. However, this larger group hated the Spanish mercenaries that were pillaging through the Netherlands. Just because only half of the Netherlands initially seceded doesn’t mean he had support from the other half. He was able to militarily suppress the other half.
